titles.title: Red Tide Emergency Relief Act of 2005
Red Tide Emergency Relief Act of 2005
A bill to authorize the Small Business Administration to provide emergency relief to shellfish growers affected by toxic red tide losses.

vote.text: Introduced in the Senate, read twice, considered, read the third time, and passed without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 6/27/2005--Passed Senate without amendment. Red Tide Emergency Relief Act of 2005 - Amends the Small Business Act to make aquaculture enterprises eligible for Small Business Administration (SBA) disaster assistance loans to small businesses. (Currently, such enterprises are specifically excluded from eligibility for such assistance.)
